intro: Neurocarpum villosum, commonly known as the hairy neurocarpum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and hairy stems and leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological studies and horticultural research.
